intro: Gymnosiphon tenellus, commonly known as the slender gymnosiphon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
